page.title: 06BUILDINGS
page.content: MANY HOUSES IN THE VILLAGES ARE BETWEEN 100 AND 300 YEARS OLD.THEY WOULD HAVE BEEN BUILT WITH DEVON COB,WITH RENDERED WALLS AND THATCHED ROOFS.THERE IS LITTLE NEW BUILDING ALLOWED BY THE PLANNING AUTHORITIES OTHER THAN FOR AGRICULTURAL PURPOSES OR WHERE A PROPERTY CAN BE BUILT INSIDE AN APPROVED AREA.THE PURPOSE OF THESE RESTRICTIONS IS TO PREVENT THE FURTHER LOSS OF FARMING LAND AND TO PREVENT THE EXISTING CHARACTER OF THE VILLAGES AND LANDSCAPE FROM BEING DESTROYED.THE THATCHED BUILDINGS GIVE THEIR OWNERS CERTAIN PROBLEMS AS THATCH DETERIORATES WITH TIME AND THE SERVICES OF A THATCHER ARE DIFFICULT TO OBTAIN AND ARE EXPENSIVE.THESE BUILDING ARE ALSO EXPENSIVE TO INSURE AGAINST FIRE.
